definitions.definition: an offence against God or against a religious or moral law

examples.text: **Confess your sins** to God and he will forgive you.
The Bible says that stealing is a sin.
It's considered a sin to be disrespectful to your parents.
Even politicians are not immune from the sins of the flesh.
Our sons will pay for the sins of their fathers.
We believe in the forgiveness of sins.
We have repented for past sins. Now it's time to move on.
Father, I have committed a sin.

definitions.definition: the act of breaking a religious or moral law

examples.text: Believers are called on to turn away from sin and embrace a life of prayer.

definitions.definition: an action that people think is very bad

examples.text: It's a sin to waste taxpayers' money like that.

definitions.definition: used to say that something that somebody does is like a punishment

examples.text: She works with us in Accounts, for her sins!

definitions.definition: to hide the real situation or facts when these are not good or pleasant

examples.text: It's a shabby old sofa but cushions and throws can hide a multitude of sins.

definitions.definition: to live together and have a sexual relationship without being married
used to emphasize that somebody is very unhappy or ugly

wordOrigin: noun Old English synn (noun), syngian (verb); probably related to Latin sons, sont- ‘guilty’.
